javaslang

Interface Convertible<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - Component type.
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Arbitrary<T>, Either<L,R>, Future<T>, Gen<T>, IndexedSeq<T>, Iterator<T>, Lazy<T>, LinearSeq<T>, List<T>, Map<K,V>, Match.MatchMonad<R>, Monad<T>, Option<T>, Seq<T>, Set<T>, SortedMap<K,V>, SortedSet<T>, Stack<T>, Stream<T>, Traversable<T>, Tree<T>, Try<T>, Value<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Array, CharSeq, Either.Left, Either.LeftProjection, Either.Right, Either.RightProjection, HashMap, HashSet, Lazy.Defined, Lazy.Undefined, LinkedHashMap, LinkedHashSet, List.Cons, List.Nil, Match.MatchMonad.Otherwise, Match.MatchMonad.Then, Option.None, Option.Some, Queue, Stream.Cons, Stream.Empty, Tree.Empty, Tree.Node, TreeMap, TreeSet, Try.Failure, Try.Success, Vector

    public interface Convertible<T>
    Conversion methods, shared by Monad and Value.
    Since:
    2.0.0
    Author:
    Daniel Dietrich

    • Method Detail

      • match

        Match.MatchMonad.Of<? extends Convertible<T>> match()
        Provides syntactic sugar for Match.MatchMonad.Of.

        We write 

        
 value.match()
      .when(...).then(...)
      .get();
        instead of 
        
 Match.of(value)
      .when(...).then(...)
      .get();
        Returns:
        a new type-safe match builder.

      • toArray

        Array<T> toArray()
        Converts this value to a Array.
        Returns:
        A new Array.

        Returns:

        T[] toJavaArray(Class<T> componentType)
        Converts this value to a typed Java array.
        Parameters:
        componentType - Component type of the array
        Returns:
        A new Java array.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if componentType is null

        Converts this value to a Map.
        Type Parameters:
        K - The key type
        V - The value type
        Parameters:

      • toLeft

        <R> Either<T,R> toLeft(Supplier<? extends R> right)
        Converts this value to a Either.
        Type Parameters:
        R - right type
        Parameters:
        right - A supplier of a right value
        Returns:
        A new Either.Right containing the result of right if this is empty, otherwise a new Either.Left containing this value.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if right is null

      • toLeft

        <R> Either<T,R> toLeft(R right)
        Converts this value to a Either.
        Type Parameters:
        R - right type
        Parameters:
        right - An instance of a right value
        Returns:
        A new Either.Right containing the value of right if this is empty, otherwise a new Either.Left containing this value.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if right is null

        Stack<T> toStack()
        Converts this value to a Stack.

        Stream<T> toStream()
        Converts this value to a Stream.
        Returns:
        A new Stream.

      • toTry

        Try<T> toTry()
        Converts this value to a Try.

        If this value is undefined, i.e. empty, then a new Failure(NoSuchElementException) is returned, otherwise a new Success(value) is returned.

        Returns:
        A new Try.

      • toTry

        Try<T> toTry(Supplier<? extends Throwable> ifEmpty)
        Converts this value to a Try.

        If this value is undefined, i.e. empty, then a new Failure(ifEmpty.get()) is returned, otherwise a new Success(value) is returned.

        Parameters:
        ifEmpty - an exception supplier
        Returns:
        A new Try.

      • toTree

        Tree<T> toTree()
        Converts this value to a Tree.
        Returns:
        A new Tree.

        Vector<T> toVector()
        Converts this value to a Vector.
        Returns:
        A new Vector.
